newsitem.title: FRANCE: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde March 20.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde March 20.

text.p: These are leading stories in afternoon daily Le Monde.
-- Italy implements emergency measures to face surge of refugees from troubled Albania.

-- LVMH luxury goods group posts 1996 results down eight percent at 3.6 billion francs. Chairman Bernard Arnault says in an interview the group will not immediately buy out DFS minority shareholder Robert Miller after negotiations became "difficult", but does not rule out eventual deal.

-- Credit Lyonnais losses to be supported by the CDR structure set up by the state to sell off Lyonnais assets are estimated at around 100 billion francs. CDR head Michel Rouger seeks to hasten asset sales.
-- State expects to earn some 30 to 50 billion francs in a partial France Telecom privatisation to be launched on May 6, listings to start from June 9.
-- Government seeks to reform conditions for awarding public works contracts, to simplify tenders and prevent abnormally low offers.
